Description: A single sheet of papyrus inscribed on one side with remains of 26 horizontal lines of fake Aramaic script, written in black ink. The papyrus is damaged and perforated by several holes, but the original edges of the document are preserved at all sides except the top. In a glazed frame accompanied by the old envelope in which the papyrus was found in the Department.
Curator's comments: The text is a forgery imitating Aramaic writing (checked by Irving Finkel).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380653) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380653)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: filmoplast t self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: Fair, incomplete
